An adaptive Python learning platform for every student, every classroom.

Our product is an adaptive online learning tool that aids teachers and students in learning and teaching programming more effectively in-class.

Find Out More

Design Brief

We are a team of five master students from Carnegie Mellon University partnered with Cross Domain to envision a product that supports programming learning in Chinese middle schools. We embarked on a strongly user-driven end-to-end research, design, and development process which has culminated in the creation of Cross Domain Collaborate.

With the promising development of K-12 programming education in China these days, Cross Domain decided to embrace this new opportunity and expand its market. As the first step, the company plans to design practical learning tools that support Python elective courses in middle schools. In particular, its targets include public and experimental schools in first-tier cities.

Get Started!

By researching K-12 programming standards and existing online Python courses, our team will apply learning science principles in the design of a supportive Python learning tool for Chinese middle school students at international and experimental schools. We aim to boost our learnersâ€™ motivation with better student-teacher interaction and emphasize their sense of achievement by incorporating more adaptive learning technologies.

Tools

What did we learn from the research?

A typical class flow

Teacher prepare pre-class materials before the class

  • Prepare class marerials
  • Release new assignment

Teacher teaches concepts and demonstrates procedural knowledge.

  • Lecture for knowledge
  • Demostrate worked example
  • Assign tasks

Teacher walk around the classroom to monitor and provide help.

  • Provide help
  • Release extended task
  • Monitor studentsâ€™ progress

Teachers need to review studentsâ€™ performance and gain feedback to make adjustments to the next class.

  • Grade on assignments
  • Write feedback

Students learn pre-class materials before the class.

  • Learn pre-class materials
  • Record questions

Student ingage int the lecture and raise hand to ask questions

  • Listen
  • Answer teacherâ€™s questions

Students practice what theyâ€™ve learned, either in a team or individually.

  • Work on tasks
  • Search online resources
  • Ask teacher
  • Cooperate with peers

Students need to finish their incompleted in-class tasks and finish homework.

  • Finish the incomplete inclass assignments
  • Do homeworks
  • Ask questions
